newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end higher, caution seen near 7,200.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end higher, caution seen near 7,200.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed higher on Wednesday, but brokers saw caution ahead of the six-year strong resistance at 7,200 points.
The index ended up 27.70 points or 0.39 percent at 7,165.46, off a 7,190.90 high. Turnover remained active at T$76.74 billion, but down from recent turnover of around T$100 billion.
Brokers attributed the rise to continuous bullish market sentiment despite a downward correction on Tuesday.
"Investors are still quite optimistic, grabbing every single bullish factor available," said Jardine Fleming Securities fund manger George Hou.
Sentiment was helped by net buying by foreign funds and local securities trust funds on Tuesday despite overall profit-taking, brokers said.
Textiles rose most on rising prices for polyester drawn texturised yarn, with Lealea Enterprise up T$1 to T$23.7.

It would take time to see whether the drawn texturised yarn price hikes were caused by rising demand from China or a reflection of domestic economic recovery, said National Securities analyst Alex Yang.
Far Eastern Textile continued to rise after it won one of eight mobile phone licenses on Monday, up T$1.4 to T$32.5.
Plastics and constructions were also strong while electronics fell slightly.

Brokers said liquidity remained quite loose to support the market. "Recent rallies were liquidity-driven," Hou of Jardine Fleming said. "And the recent successful fund raising by several securities trust funds showed that investors are waiting to jump into the market."
However, analysts said they did not expect the 7,200-point resistance to be easily broken through. A consolidation range of 7,100-7,200 was seen for Thursday.
